name: oO
description: "oO" is a hardcore minimal arcade game.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: 2 Ghz Dual Core Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Graphics card supporting DirectX 9.0c and Shader Model 3.0 Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: Any

reviews.review_text: Easy to learn, hard to master. Fun and frustrating.  There's a free version availiable, but imo the Dev deserves the price he asks for.

MOTHER F***KER Rage, rage and more rage!  You pass through the first levels very quickly, then the extreme levels come on, the blades start to spin, pop in and out of the circles, the whole world starts to distort. oO is a rage inducing, fast paced game, You are a little white circle, making your way out of the death ridden area.  It reminds me of the 2002 web game where you beat the hell out of your computer. Makes me feel the same way. Overall, its a fun game!  I give it 7.5/10.

This game makes me cry. Seriously. Excellent music makes up for it though. Also, not quite FPS friendly. It could easlily be 60 but smh runs at 45 average. Nonetheless it's a good one and pretty cheap. Get it and start crying.
Simple but dificult and very fun!
This game is so fun.

Very addicting, very hard  I just can't put the game down until i have completed it, i haven't even beat the blue stage i have 100 deaths on it  but i would recommend a level editor to make your own hard as crap levels.   Very rage inducing  9/11 would rage again
Difficulty = (Super Hexagon + Dark Souls) x 9000
Frustration Anguish Fun
Circular Dark Souls  10.1/10
If you enjoy games like 'the impossible game' and if you like the feeling that you want to rip someones head off. Enjoy this game. Know your limit play within it.
It's a good game. I've beaten all of it and got low death counts. Please fix the ESC key though.
Very fun game Wish it had a level editor 9/10
Can't wait for this to be on one dollar one hour...
I rate this game 10/10 Meatballs.   Check out my vid and you too will understand:         YouTube™ Video:  The Best Video Game Name Ever!!!
Great game love it

One of those games where you will be stuck on a certain part for ages, take a break, then beat it on your first try. Also one of those games where you will want to break your motherboard in half over.
This is the friggin hardest game i've ever played. What you need to not is that this game is super rage mode so dont buy it if you have breakables like glass and such near you.
Same mechanics of old games, were reflex and alertness ruled. Awesome game, highly recomended.
Well... After 6 hours and about 3,000 deaths I finally beat it. This game is well worth the $0.99 price.
THIS GAME MADE ME ANGRY THE HARDEST!!!!!!!! GGGGRRRRRRRR!!!! D:<
A fun simple cheap game with super tough yet satisfying achievments, worth the buy.
Simple. Challenging. Fun. Not early access. What else could you possibly expect for 99 cents? Strongly recommend.
I didnt think it would be that hard at first.  If you underestimate this game it will punish you.  Badly.
Record 47 on red after 2.3 hours, believe it or not. Awesome game.
Buying a new computer moniter simulator 2016  10/10
I highly recommend this game if you like hating everything ever. I have just reached Level 4 and it's probably induced more rage in me than the rest of my Steam Library combined.

in four words:  FRUSTRATING, CHALLENGING, HARDCORE, PSYCEDELIC (endless mode)  totally worth the 99 cents that i paid for it  pros: -challenging -achievments -very cheap -endless mode -runs on every computer  cons: -frustrating sometimes

This game is both exhilirating and frustrating, with a hefty dose of fun and awesomeness. It doesn't take long to get the hang of, and can get addictive! The soundtrack is epic as well.  A great deal, seeing as it's only around a dollar. I don't see how anyone could go wrong by getting this.  Hugely recommended :D

I bought this game for less than 10 cents, played it for a while and then called it a rage quit. Several months later I found out they added achievements, so I played it for another while and rage quitted once again. I would say it's worth the 10 cents, but I wouldn't spend more than that on this game.  Warning: Do not buy oO if you get easily frustrated.
Observation. calmness, reflexes, precisicion, you'll need all of this, and lot's and lot's of patience.

It's the kind of game you play for 5 minutes before you start screaming, destory your keyboard and have the police called on you by your neighbours because they think you are murdering a 5 year old... ♥♥♥♥ you neighbours.

This game is totaly sick , just put some epic music ontop of it ( Super meat boy ) and ready your reflexes !!!  Only 1h played right now but man ... The rage quit is too strong , but i'll play more for sure .

oO is a fun little game totally worth the 99 cents.  All you have to do is to lead a small white sphere from a ball to another while avoiding spikes. First stage is quite easy but at later levels things such as moving spikes and timed spikes (they disappear and reappear in a certain pattern).  After beating a level you can try a twisted version of it where everything is wobbly and non-circular.  Endless mode is quite fun and is randomized every try. You can get a super lucky run and easily get 100 points or you can get a super hard run and have trouble getting 6 points.  Oh, and fourth level will destroy you.

This is a pretty interesting game and at the start it is actually a lot of fun. However it quickly turns into remembering patterns and perfect timing. I also feel like there are too little checkpoints. It happens too often that I try to get through a part but it just won't happen, then I finally get through it only to die a few seconds later without ever seeing a checkpoint.  And then there is the input lag. This game is all about perfect timing. Got you timing 1% off? Too bad, try again. The problem is that there is a small amount of input lag (very small amount, that usually won't be noticable), which is really bad in this type of game.  Pros: Good visuals Decent soundtrack  Neutral: Interesting game mechanics at first, but turns into frustration later  Cons: Very frustrating Input lag  Overall I wouldn't recommend this game (not even for this price) because of the frustration and the input lag.

This game is not fun. It requires very exact split second timing and if you happen to have a nervous disability then more often than not, you will either get the timing wrong or hit the space bar more than once (double bounce). Either way, it is back to the previous checkpoint!
